author: Bobby B.

description:
This place has mastered the art of fast, fresh delicious Mexican food. Like a lot of other taqueria's, you can see all the ingredients and make your burrito, tacos, enchilada, etc just like you want them - a la carte or make a plate w/ beans and rice. They have a great variety of meats but they have grilled and steamed veggies for vegetarian meal and everything is fresh with the ingredients constantly replaced. They don't charge for their fresh made chips, prices are real good and they have Mexican beers in the fridge. 

My favorite thing here is the Azteca burrito - It's a super burrito with just rice, beans and meat inside, topped with enchilada sauce and melted cheese, and then topped with sour cream, salsa and guacamole. Mmmm.... massive, wet and delish to the last bite. Their hot sauce is tasty and spicy and their to-go packaging is reliable.
author: Kristina A.

description: Food is ok but I have a HUGE pet peeve when it comes to taqueria's and their rice.  Why do they put peas in perfectly good rice???  This is a very strange practice and I do not understand it and I actually avoid places that do this.  Peas do not taste good in Mexican food.  No idea what they are thinking.
author: Karen C.

description:
I am a fan for the following reasons:

1) Great Fajita Burritos with tomato tortillas
2) Decent Taquitos - If I ever had company at the last minute, I would totally buy these to entertain
3) Marinated TOFU!  This place is great for vegetarians.  Although, like almost any taqueria, if you are a strict veg then I wouldn't suggest dining here and i'm sure they sometimes use the same utensils for meat and veggies, but still, solid place, perhaps even for Vegans. 

I agree with the sentiments of another Yelper - the guac isn't great... I don't like it's sour-creamy texture... but everything else is pretty good!
author: Maulie D.

description:
I always head here for an affordable, filling lunch in Noe Valley. Of course it's not really comparable to the far better taquerias in the Mission, but it is good for a quick Mexican fix. They have an extensive menu with many vegetarian options. I like how you can pick what type of tortilla (flour, wheat, or spinach) you want went your order a burrito/quesadilla. I often just get a regular burrito which is pretty big for about 4 dollars. The carnitas and grilled chicken are always safe bets. I feel like their food is slightly less greasy than at other Mexican places which is plus. They also give you free chips and salsa if you ask. I wish their spicy salsa had more of a kick though. 

The one thing I would not recommend is the fish tacos. They just give you a small sliver of tasteless salmon that they slap on the grill for a few minutes. It's totally not worth the money.
author: Bonita L.

description:
Considering I eat here at least twice a week, you would think I would give it a better review, but my frequency is more of a matter of convenience and price. Overall the food is good, but just not outstanding.

I will give a four star rating to my favorite dish, THE SUPER TACO: two soft tortillas (stacked) with rice, beans, meat, guac, sour cream, salsa cheese and lettuce. I usually go with carnitas and pinto beans here. The ingredients are stacked on a plate or in a to go box for the amazingly low price of $3.91 after tax. Oh, and that includes chips and salsa.

This is more than enough food for most people making it a great bargain. If you are on 24th (up in Noe) and want to stop in, you should. But if you pass through the Mission to get here, you made a mistake.
author: Kemp M.

description: good enough food but make sure to ask for the burrito in tin foil or something cus otherwise, it just comes out on a plate and is impossible to eat.
author: Jess C.

description: We love this place.  It has been our favorite Mexican place for over ten years.  Wonderful burritos and tacos.  The meat is delicious, lean and fresh.  I love watching the meat guy grilling carne asada, cutting up grilled chicken...making everything from scratch.  We recommend the chile verde burrito.  The chicken mole and grilled chicken and beef are also terrific.  And we always end our meal with the flan and/or rice pudding!
author: Aki L.

description:
The lenten season brings me to eat a little healthier: no soda, no deep fried foods. To top the cake, no meat on Fridays.

Last friday, my boyfriend and I came here to gobble on their melt-in-your-mouth shrimp quesedillas and sort-of-alright grilled fish tacos. The great thing about this place is that they prepare the hot food in front of you, none of which was fried. The crappy thing was the bland grilled fish tacos. Oh, I crave for batter-fried fish tacos. Forty-something more days...
author: Ramona P.

description: Holy Relleno! i got a chili relleno on the side of my enchiladas and this thing was the size of my face! and i have a pretty big head. fairly priced and large portions will bring me back here to try their other items. the enchiladas were a bit on the dry side if i had to say anything but over all friendly staff and good food.
author: Matt F.

description: The ingredients are fresh. Lot's of options... TOO many options - the menu is confusing. The prices are, well, a rip. $3.80 for *one* taco with no extras. They let the salsa go sharp on the salsa bar. I'm being generous - 2.5 stars really.
author: Chuck S.

description:
I came across this taqueria when I first visited the city for a two-week vacation. Since then, I've broken up, made friends, annoyed my boyfriend, and even fallen in love... all because of CM dos. 

I first visited with my ex who used to frequent the dos when he lived in SF. He said it was the best place to eat because if you're poor you can buy a burrito for 5 bucks or so and spread it out over two meals. This was hardly the glowing review I wanted to hear of the restaurant where I would be having the first lunch of my SF vacation. My snobbery was quickly dismantled when a burrito the size of my calf appeared on my plate. Sold!

When I moved to the city, I did exactly as my ex suggested. Some might say "oh, how the mighty have fallen" in a snarky tone, but they probably don't have many friends. 

Now, I can't consider any friendship valid unless it meets one of two requirements: I've introduced them to CM dos, or they already love it. Naysayers need not apply for my affection. 

Perhaps CM dos had something to do with my taste for latino men, perhaps it didn't; we'll never know for sure. But I now have a Mexican boyfriend, and CM dos is a site of contention for us. It's not that he dislikes the food (see aforementioned passage on friendship validity), but he rather dislikes how I pronounce the name of the restaurant: using a hard x sound instead of the more correct h sound. I don't remember if I was embarrassed or angered by this observation, but it probably didn't end well, so I'll let sleeping dogs lie. 

But alas, should he ever leave me, I have a backup plan. Yelpers, I have fallen in kinda-love!... with the lady who works in the CM dos serving line. Her hoop earrings were just picante enough to catch my eyes, and I have a hunch that her nimble hands and knowledge of how to make my chili relleno burrito juuuust right would satisfy me to the end of my days. To be honest, I would probably love her mole chicken and chili rellenos more than her, but all relationships have their muddy areas. 

I'm not sure what else Casa MeXicana Dos has in store for me, but its track record is astounding. Between repeatedly impacting my life and introducing me to the biggest and best burritos this side of south-of-the-border, my heart will always belong to the little taqueria that could in Noe Valley.
author: Brian K.

description: You know what to expect of a burrito this far away from the Mission. My salmon burrito was better than her steak fajita burrito.
author: Rob T.

description:
Okay, so I was probably 10 or 11 at the time, but one day I was hanging out with a new girl who just transferred to my grammar school, and her mother took us here where I ate my very first burrito. That's right, my burrito cherry was popped here, and since then it's held a very special place in my heart. Sure, there are better burritos in the city, especially since the mission is only a few blocks away, but this is comfort food. 

I still remember exactly what was on that burrito, and keep coming back for more. 

So now-a-days it's not as popular as it used to be, where you would have to wait in long lines, but it's still just as good. Some words of caution though, if the place looks pretty empty, you might want to avoid things like refried beans, they tend to congeal a little if they've been sitting there for too long. 

Everything is always fresh and well cooked, their agua fresca is also amazing.
author: Allyson S.

description:
Lots to choose from. Full tummy for a few greens. Line moves quick enough to avoid any sighing or shifting of your weight.  Fresh Salsa.

Average experience for the tastebuds.

Rice could use a little more moistYness. Chicken chimi's were more tortilla than anything. Chips a little too hard.

Not ecstatic about the experience, but not dissapointed either.
author: Megan M.

description: Excellent breakfast burrito. Ordered mushroom and eggs. Added chicken and had the whole thing grilled to perfection. Yum! Inexpensive to boot.
author: Matt S.

description: It's an okay choice if you're in the vicinity, craving a burrito or some nachos, and you're too lazy to walk down to the Mission.
author: Zell C.

description: The food here was thoroughly mediocre, although I appreciated that they offered grilled salmon (for your taco, burrito, whatever) and straight-up avocado instead of guac. Would probably only come back if I were in a pinch.
author: Elle B.

description: Mediocre.  My brother ordered a super carne asada and it was cold. The cheese was not melted and they threw in lettuce (yuk) even though he asked them not to. My regular chicken burrito was dull. What's worse is the sassy attitude behind the counter. I didn't enjoy paying for the food when it seemed like we were just a bother to them. (We didn't even ask for any substitutions) Nope. I'll take my  business elsewhere.
author: Carmen M.

description:
We just moved to the neighborhood and need good Mexican food weekly so we thought we would give this place a shot.  Bad idea.

Wanting low fat, we ordered the tofu burrito and the rice and bean burrito.  We had different beans and salsas in each burrito to mix it up a bit but they were both a huge disappointment.

If you are really hungry and just need something nutritious to fill your gut, this will work, they even have whole wheat tortillas.  Otherwise, walk a few more blocks down 24th and you will hit the really good places.  Almost any where between Valencia and Portrero on 24th offers really good Mexican.

Mexican and Noe Valley just don't go together.
author: Brenda B.

description:
I will admit, this is my neighborhood Burrito spot, so  I love this place.
Generous portions, high volume so everything is always fresh.

Some of the folks there make better Burritos than others, but I have never had a bad one.  The Fajita Burritos are especially yummy.

I hear there are better taquaria's in the mission , but nothing beats my favorite local joint.
author: David R.

description: Okay prices, but the food was just okay. My tacos came with nothing but meat - which I think is pretty odd, and not especially delicious. The service was pretty poor.
author: Greg H.

description:
They not only serve tasteless Mexican food - which I didn't think possible - they serve it cold to lukewarm.
Add to that a dirty restaurant and you have a place that lacks any appeal.  
Someone should open a decent burrito place in Noe Valley.
author: Dixter D.

description: Very fresh and tasty. A bit pricey for Mexican cafeteria style food, but this is Noe Valley. A bargain is the flour Tostada. Free chips plus a variety of salsas, self-serve iced lemon water. Not very clean floors, utensils, and tables, but this is a high-volume convenience joint.
author: Lotion M.

description:
Such a good taqueria! The food is 5 stars, and the chefs are really nice. They have a lot of variety as well as tried and true favorites (e.g. rice, beans, cheese burrito).

The space is fairly old, but it has a nice homey Mexican feel to it. Many people get takeout, so there is pretty much always seating.

Great for kids and adults alike. Check it out!
author: Catherine L.

description:
Food was good, enough said.

The reason for the two star review was the pricing bait and switch, and the lack of explanation of the pricing, inconsistency between menu pricing and what I was charged.

We ordered a super veggie and a chorizo breakfast burrito.  The super was unaltered and the price somehow jumped from $5.50 to $8.50. On the breakfast burrito I asked for cheese, jalepenos, hot sauce, pico and a tiny bit of lettuce and the price also jumped up nearly $3.  I expect to be charged for cheese - even though a breakfast burrito should have cheese - but to be charged for lettuce!!! WTF!!!

At least they had the Giants game on.
author: Alex K.

description: I've gone to this place many times over the years, simply for convenience and stomach fodder. You won't get sick, but you won't enjoy your meal either. I'd say this place defines mediocrity, if you want the real thing walk the extra blocks to the Mission... or convince someone to finally open a decent Mexican place in the Valley.
author: Tobias P.

description:
Love this place. Really fast, really good ... never lets me down! I love their super burritos. With avocado instead of guacamole. Yum. Always have a good selection of agua frescas and love that they have breakfast burritos now too. 

If you could give 4.5 stars, I'd do that because the one thing that could make it better? If they stayed open just a teeny bit later. Noe Valley sorely needs more options after 10 pm then the donut place. If they pushed to 11, I'd be there at 10:30 with bells on! 

If you're not into the kid scene, beware this place is total kid so it can be a bit of a zoo after school or on Saturday afternoons. But then again, if you aren't kid friendly, you're not likely to find yourself in Noe anyways.
author: Isabel G.

description: Good quick bite! Add guacamole and cilantro and I'm happy everytime
author: Alaina I.

description:
don't go here.  i know, you're in that hood and are too lazy to go to the mission, but resist the urge!

it smells like any other taqueria but they serve their burritos cold.  which means all that lukewarm/cold stuff is sitting there germinating some additional protein.  about an hour after eating there i got a sore throat and some kind of weird hacking cough that i couldnt shake for two weeks.  all my symptoms are gone now but still wondering what the hell that was (not a cold).   maybe the server had swine flu or something.   this is what i get for wanting a quick lunch between errands.

if you must get something there, microwave the shit out of it before you eat it.  and make sure you get your hep-B shots.

worst mexican place ever.  and disgusting.  the fda or whatever organization that is that checks food hygiene should check this place out.
author: X X.

description:
1) Bad guacamole.
2) Bad "hot" salsa.

a) Ripe avocados
b) Better pollo asado than any mission taqueria
c) Excellent salsa ranchera, which is plenty hot.

Several of my friends hate this taqueria because of their gross runny guacamole. This is avoidable. You will awkwardly request that they construct custom guacamole on the burrito by way of ordering avocado, cilantro, onions, salsa, etc., and you will have excellence in foil. If you are a chickenatarian, it is better than any burrito in the mission.

Unfortunately, they squish your burrito wrong when they roll it up, but this is survivable. If you care more about the tortilla crispiness, then stick to Taqueria Cancun.
author: Ben D.

description:
I really like the burritos and they have a good selection of meats and the veggie options look good. I must admit, it's close to my house and if I have a little more time, I prefer Papalote.

Always friendly, fast service and good, fresh chips. I nearly always get the chile verde pork super burrito, but was VERY close to going with the chorizo today, which I haven't tried yet. I admit, this place is more like 3.51 stars, but that rounds to 4.
author: herf j.

description:
A safe, well lit place for tacos.

It's like taking a field trip to the Mission with valet stroller parking and handy table-side access to the Noe Valley Voice.

My favorite taco in SF.
author: Jack K.

description: Ok...it's been a while since I've visited this restaurant but I still remember the lousey food that I got. Ok, first off this place really doesn't seem clean. In a place like Noe Valley you would expect something a little nicer. My food was not good at all. I had a chicken burrito which was given to me very cold....like ice cold at one part. Yeah the price isn't bad but I'd recommend checking out some of the other nearby restaurants instead.
author: Barbara O.

description: Best Mexican food in Noe Valley.
author: Joel W.

description: I love Casa Mexicana 2 and then 1, in that order, and have been to both. It's right next to Savor which is also one of my other favorite places.  I have never been disappointed with the quality of food @Casa Mexicana and everyone's nice too. A great place for lunch or a very very early dinner. There're many great Mexican places in the city and this is one of them. The only negative thing I would say is that their TV & music is too LOUD and can make your dining experience really miserable.
author: Marc N.

description: I would have given it a 3 star but the Lady's working there are pretty rude the food was OK I normally get the sope with chicken but the chicken has a lot fat and it was really chewy... The rice and beans are really good...
author: veronica n.

description:
BURRITO: The chicken in the "super burrito" was dried.  The burrito was small, the staff was more interested in talking to each other than serving their customers. 

GUACAMOLE:  I didn't know you could make guacamole that looks and tastes like green mayonnaise.  

QUESADILLA:  Dried out and completely tasteless.  

Is there any decent Mexican restaurant in San Francisco?
author: Mike O.

description:
i know this seems wrong.  to give casa mexicana II 5 stars when a few short blocks away there are your el farolitos, your papalotes and your cancuns.  but let me explain my case in 3 parts:

part 1)  they have outstanding tofu ranchero burritos.  this burrito is fantastic...the tofu is firm and slathered in a sweet, slightly spicy ranchero sauce and then piled into a tortilla with rice, your choice of beans (all vegetarian) and salsa.  I add avocado to mine and this burrito is heavenly.  you can also choose your type of tortilla...white, wheat, spinach or tomato.  that isn't that appealing of an option to me because it reminds me too much of california style skinny-fication of the delicious fatty burrito but hey.  maybe you are skinny and want to stay that way.  that's your business.

part B)  they have other veggie options too which i have branched out and tried...grilled veggies and cactus are also delightful.  

part III)  the last time i was there, one of the neighborhood homeless guys was in front of me ordering what sounded like a fairly complicated list of food.  they made it up for him on a big plate along with a glass of horchata and a glass of strawberry fresca.  they didn't charge him AND SERVED HIM AT HIS TABLE!  they don't even do that for paying customers!  when i offered to pay for the man, the lady at the cashier politely declined saying that she is happy to be able to help him.  i swear to god, it was all i could do to hold myself back from giving the cashier lady an awkwardly long hug in the middle of her lunch rush.  

so for all of those reasons, 5 stars to casa mexicana II.  and heed the words of chris m...this is a place for veggie burritos, not meat ones.  i am totally impartial when i say this as i am just your average go-with-the-flow joe with no feelings about meat and the eating of it one way or the other.
author: Laura B.

description: Everything on the menu - everything! - is less than mediocre.  From the stale and cold chips to the lackluster vegetarian options to the salsa.... it's either bad or just barely average.
author: Christine M.

description: Dont even think about, hands down the WORST burrito place on the planet! I can't begin to describe how ripped off I felt eating here. NAUSEATING. Don't be fooled by the good reviews, probably written by their employees.  Read the real reviews below (the ones with 1 star)  'NUFF SAID.
author: C E.

description: Stars only for the surprisingly good nachos!!! Excellently fresh and with beans (yum). Been on a nacho trek around the taquerias in the city and this one is up there.
author: Eos d.

description: A healthy alternative to the greasy mexican joints in the Mission. The "taco" is more like a soft tostada, piled high with lots of fresh goodies. You have to eat it with a fork. They have a great tofu, and a yummy boiled spicy chicken. Recommend you start with just one Super Taco, they are huge!
author: Julie C.

description: I'm a fan of the vegetarian burrito mainly because whenever I get any meat added, bad things happen.  I'll leave it at that.  They have about 5 choices for veggie people and quite a few more for carnivores.  Pretty good quality.  Decently priced.  I'd go again and not necessarily because it's only two blocks away from my place.
author: Chris M.

description: Unimpressive and generic but it's clean which is more than I can say for the places down the hill.  They have great vegetarian options but other than that, it's just a run of the mill burrito place.
author: Maria D.

description: Okay, I have to say that I don't really enjoy SF Mexican food. It doesn't really compare to the food down south. But this place is pretty good. The carnitas meat is flavorful and the have pretty quick service.
author: Tyrone B.

description: I LOVE Casa Mexicana!  We live nearby and have been going there every week or two for a few years now.  I like that you can see the whole kitchen in action and that all the food is freshly made.  The staff is friendly, recognize us and have been around since our first visit.  I'm always suspicious of businesses with high staff turnover.   Never been disappointed here and feel they have decent sized portions and prices.
author: Kirsten H.

description: I moved out of Noe Valley and I *miss* casa mexicana like you can't imagine.  I used to get dinner from here 2 times a week and was in love with their chicken tacos.  Their fire-roasted salsa is amazing, and you can add yummy extras like cilantro and avocado.  The people who work there are so nice, the place is clean, and the price is definitely right.
author: C J.

description: This place is such a letdown. We live close by and I was so hoping that I would be able to have a good Mexican option where a hill wouldn't be involved. Unfortunately, my burrito was not so hot - it was just very bland and tasteless.  The guac was that watery green sourcreamy stuff. *sigh* I guess I will continue dealing with the hills.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This was my neighborhood burrito shop when I lived down the street. It was great to get a Mission-quality burrito and be able to eat it in Noe Valley. In any other city this place would be five star but let's face it, burrito competition is cut-throat in SF. Try the Azteca (wet) burrito. It's a real treat.
author: Aaron V.

description: I've eaten here many times but on our last visit we saw 5 roaches.  That pretty much trumps anything else I could say about this restaurant.
author: Dean P.

description: On a recent trip to San Fran, I went here with two coworkers for some well earned Mexican delights. I tend to have high standards for Mex, and I thought the food was pretty good, and I'd disagree with the complaints that this place is dirty. It's a simple taqueria, not Le Cirque. The prices were good, food looked and smelled good, and portions were generous.
author: Gerard S.

description: We love this place especially our 5 year old son. We tried to go to Casa Mexicana once week during the past 9 years (my wife 20 years). The food is always fresh, staff very friendly and relatively cheap. I really do not care for burritos being from DC and usually order the shrimp, chicken or beef tacos or other special entree'. It is always very good and I actually had a super burrito the last few times and they were exceptional! We have an annual tradition to have dinner here after trick-or-treating on Halloween. It was a treat again this year.
author: Michael R.

description: Vegetarian burritos are awesome here!!! I like the nachos too. One of the best places to get Mexican food in the city.
author: Bernadette B.

description: Cuando yo quiero Taco Bell...voy a Casa Mexicana en cambio.  La comida es mas mejor, y no tengo que ir al bano toda la noche.
author: Ann L.

description: Got a tofu ranchero burrito here with guac, plus a chicken tamale (banana leaf style). The tamal was better. And as I was walking home back to the Mish, right past Papalote, I realized that's where I should've gotten dinner. Good prices here, though.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Noe Valley Taqueria...Not a lot of choices for Mexican food on 24th street, so I think they get a lot of business by default.  It is good though, and this is one of the few places I will actually get a vegetarian burrito.
author: Pele N.

description: Ehh. There are far better places to get Mexican than this place. I give it three stars because of their many choices of meat and my bf said the nachos were good. Yet, it didn't wow us. Very clean and lots of kids.
author: Katy D.

description:
Yeah, yeah, I know you're meant to go to the Mission for the ultimate burrito. But Casa Mexicana is 5 mins from my house, and has never let me down as my default lunch burrito place. 
Lots of choice of meat - I usually go for the steak but the marinated pork (achiote?) is damn good too; all your usual burrito choices plus quesadillas, "specials", breakfast burritos etc etc. Fantastic. They also have a salsa bar to load up on with your free chips.


 In short, I love this place.
author: Sadie C.

description:
I used to like this place ... until the day I came across their workers demonstrating against the management outside. Not a good sign. I found out about management's alleged abusive practices against their employees: 

http://cbs5.com/business/azteca.taqueria.complaints.2.779706.html

Now I wouldn't touch this place with a 10-foot pole. No way am I eating food made cheap by ripping off honest working people.
author: Randy D.

description: Sorry, Casa.  You no flauta my boata.
author: Jessica M.

description: Delicious, generous portions of good quality taqueria food.  Very friendly and efficient service.  It is pleasant to eat here or take food out, which I do frequently.  Yummmy!
author: Catherine E.

description: I love this place. I love the variety, should I get an all veggie burrito or a tofu one? How about just a black bean and cheese? Or maybe a mushroom quesadilla? How about a spinach tortilla? I appreciate the fact that they have lots of meatless options, not that I don't eat meat, but sometimes I just want something lighter. When I do eat meat here it's not heavy like some other places meat is. I don't feel all weighed down after eating, which I loooooove. I do recommend getting fresh avo, skip the strange guacamole. The agua de melon (melon juice) is very tasty, I think sometimes they have different kinds. The red, hot salsa is delicious. I've always had a good experience here. Maybe I should go today...
author: gabby m.

description: Ok, don't go here expecting gourmet, and you'll be just fine.  You have to be selective about what you order, but there are a lot of options to customize, which is what makes this taqueria so worthwhile .  Their burritos and tacos are delish...especially love that they have onion, cilantro, WHOLE avocado, and good bean, meat, vegetarian, and tortilla variety.  For all of those complaining about cold, bland burritos, try leaving out the lettuce and tomato...just turns it soupy!  Also, found out the hard way not to order a shrimp quesadilla.  Yuck...bay shrimp??!!  Uh, so NOT ok.  So, word to the wise...stick with the burritos or tacos, and everything will be fine.
author: Julie T.

description:
what did i have for dinner last night you might ask? i had a quite greasy fajita chicken ala carte, served with salad (lettuce and a slice of tomato) and four corn totillas, which was very palatable.
i also observed while waiting in line, that they very generous putting meat & vegetables fillings on their burrito dishes.
will i give this place a second chance? why not.
author: Nelle A.

description: It's a solid neighborhood taqueria. Is it spectacular? No. But after a long day, it's perfect when you want something quick, consistently pretty good, and relatively cheap.
author: Angie Y.

description: I came here for some Fish Tacos at lunch, and the place definitely makes a good fresh taco: just don't expect to be able to pick it up in any way, shape, or form. Prices are very inexpensive and the place isn't all that bad; the staff is also really friendly.
author: Eston B.

description: Not great food, especially when you consider how many good options there are nearby in the Mission or Glen Park (La Corneta). I would give it two stars, but they get +1 for being open late and being near my house...
author: Jason Y.

description: So, being a native californian, I am always on the lookout for the perfect burrito. I may have found it after nearly twenty five years of searching far and wide. Casa Mexicana Dos! Yes please, give me a burrito chalk full of all the good stuff, and on top of that could you please put an entirely cheese filled chili relleno? you can? ooh thank you! The service was quick and the horchata looked delicious, I will have to try it when I choose a less filling meal next time.  It's a good thing that it is nowhere near where i live because I would gain an increadible amount of weight no doubt.
author: Carley B.

description:
- Soggy burritos. Tonight they actually drained out a lot of liquid over a trash can prior to rolling up the burrito.
- "guacamole" is the consistency of pea soup and the flavor is similar
- temperature is sub-par.  If I get a burrito here, I always nuke it when I get home.  
- the service is not what you would venture to call friendly

I admit we come here from time to time because we live nearby.  We may just need to change our ways and either go to Glen Park for La Corneta where they have real guac, or to the mission.  

If you are driving through Noe, don't stop. Keep going east to Mission and you will find many better places to get a burrito.
author: Kim S.

description: Lots of choices, line moves quickly, plenty of space to din-in, and the food is good and very filing.  It's been there for a long while, and hit the "Casa" when I feel Mexican in Noe Valley.
author: Tiberius A.

description: Great nachos, good chiles rellenos, quick service.  Kinda lacking in ambiance, but whatever.  Prices are about a buck over Mission prices, but what do you expect really in Noe Valley?  Good basic taqueria food, friendly point at what you want service.
author: Jake S.

description: If you are craving even semi-authentic mexican food, this isn't the place for you. The food is so-so, and for the price, the portions should be more generous. I asked for a little more meat on my super nachos (she put very little) and not only did I get a funny look from the lady, when I went to pay, got charged extra. My advice: Go to El Farolito on Mission at 24th, they are tasty, inexpensive and they serve HUGE portions.
author: Lauren G.

description: Burritos are ok, good chimichangas. Usually can get in and out very quickly even if it's crowded.
author: andy c.

description: Great place for a fast meal. Love the burritos my latin sisters are always friendly and cheerful especially the cute cashier with the long hair. :)
author: jerry p.

description: Best broccoli burrito ever, if that's what you're into. Also has a great salsa selection. Good whole wheat tortillas. A healthy alternative to the greasy (but delicious) fare down the hill...
author: Kelsey E.

description: I am surprised the reviews are so poor for this place.  I love their burritos!  The veggie burrito with guacamole and steamed veggies is sooo tasty!  Then for a real treat, cover it with enchilada sauce and you are in heaven.  Although I have to say I saw a wicked protest outside a few weeks ago and haven't been back.  Something about back pay, labor rights, and poor treatment by the owner.  That is such a buzz kill cause the place really is tasty.  Not sure I will go back until they work their shiz out.  I don't want to support a place that doesn't respect it's employees.
author: Roberta J.

description: The closest thing I've found to the Tex-Mex nachos I grew up on in Big D. Friendly staff, and everything is made fresh, right in front of you.  Yummy flan! :-)
author: Megan K.

description: This place is ok. The only thing I order is the super nachos.  It's way overpriced for the quality though. Its usually inconsistent with amount you get too. Little Chihuahua down the street is better and Papalote is even better than the small dog. Unless you're hard up for a burrito save your money and go somewhere else.
author: M M.

description: I've sadly had some bad meals over the span of my life, but the one I had at Casa Mexicana probably tops them all - oh wait B Bar was worse, but the staff was nice. My mom's oyster casserole was way worse, but my mom made it with good intention so that meal gets a pass. So yep, Casa Mexicana's unprofessional and immature staff served me up the worse pile garbage I ever called supper. Soggy tasteless slop that smelled like a old refrigerator. And the chicken was ancient old gangly thigh meat - I think. Who knows really. Oh and a note on the staff - from my one on one experience, they are  basically a bunch miserable teenagers who appear to hate their jobs and therefore the customers. Oh, except they are not teenagers - they are in their 30s and 40s. Literally the cook rolled her eyes at me when she made a mistake and started make a burrito when I clearly ordered a taco. And they the cashier rolled his eyes at me when I asked for a to go cup for my size or horrid salsa. I would go hungry before going back to such a gross and rude place.
author: I. V.

description: Since i have basically grown up in Noe Valley i love this place. My friends and I would always come here after school to eat, and to this day i always come back! I love the veggie burritos!
author: maria p.

description: I'm sure there are better burritos in the world, but Casa Mexicana makes my favorite. I go there every time I'm in San Francisco. They make my stomach ridiculously happy.
author: Alexa G.

description: This is a very cute, casual place to eat. I always get the super taco and a flan. The flan is soo delicious! It's as quick as chipotle but tastier in my opinion!
author: Amy K.

description: I love their flexibility. They will gladly custom make anything. My kids love it, I love it. Plus, you never get sick from the meat here!
author: Patty S.

description: The guacamole looked like chunky green water. That pretty much killed it for me.
author: Alexis C.

description: we walked into here yesterday (monday/holiday) and guess what, it was the azteca mexican place next to my house in castro. yes, there's a different name but inside it's EXACTLY the same. same menu in the same order with the same color on the menu even. The burrito i always get is even still called azteca burrito. i got a taco instead, to pretend it was a different place. it was good. this is a good place when you  want a quick meal, but it's not a real mexican place. if i hadn't have been looking for a real mexican place, i'd like it just as much as i like azteca right next to my house. so i'll rate it well. :)
author: Merredith L.

description: Huge portions and delicious refried beans, plus a salsa bar all very cheap.  I'm a vegetarian so I can only speak for their veggie burritos.  The guacamole is also excellent.
author: Carla K.

description: We opted for Mexican last night, and decided to stay in the hood, instead of heading to the Mission. Big mistake. This place did what I thought was impossible: several different ingredients (pork, sour cream, beans, etc.) and exactly zero taste. It was the most bland thing I've ever eaten. No flavor, nothing but texture. Really disappointing.
author: andrea a.

description: Just about the only affordable place on the block.  And yet, not a dive.  Great variety, amazing meats.  The hibiscus agua fresca is nasty but the horchata was the best we'd ever had.  Huge portions.  Yum!
author: C H.

description: love this place. i live closer to the mission and i know i know, there are much better mexican restaurants there, but most of the time the food is too spicy for my irish ass.  here they have mild, medium and spicy chicken.  this is my go to place for mexican food. i have been eating here once a week for the last 8 years. great variety, whether i'm up for quesadillas, burritos or enchiladas.  and they make it however you like down to each ingredient if you're picky like me. spacious area in the back too so you can eat your grub. wide variety of mexican and american beers, sodas and even my fav.... jarritos!
author: Ms. M.

description: still on 24th st but in noe valley, the prices here are unsurprisingly higher than the other taquerias on 24th. in addition to the standard meat options, there are plenty of 'fancier' chicken choices, including chicken mole, chioptle chicken, etc. we each ordered a burrito and neither was constructed well and fell apart quickly - they really need to learn to roll burritos tighter. i accidentally ordered a super burrito with guac and sour cream but they also put in lettuce, which i would not recommend. all in all, a decent taqueria that will come in handy since we live a block away but doesn't really hold up to the taquerias on 24th in the mission.
author: Angi C.

description: This place is OK.  I was really craving a tasty fully loaded burrito so I got their super burrito.  It wasn't all oozy and delish like I had craved, so I was really disappointed.  I also got their strawberry aqua fresca which was also just OK.  It seemed really diluted and wasn't very sweet.  Next time, I'll drive and head to the real deal further down 24th in the Mission.
author: Claire P.

description: I've lived close by all my life, so I'm pretty familiar with this place.  In my experience, it can be both pretty good as well pretty disappointing.  My main advice is to stay away from the guacamole.  To my tastes at least, it usually breaks the burritos.  Also, the hot sauce isn't too hot, but that's a minor problem (don't get me wrong, I love spicy stuff, but it doesn't effect taste or anything).  The steak is grilled nicely, not flavorless or rubbery or gristly, though I've also had much better carne asada at a quite a few places too.  The chile relleno burritos are pretty good, and the dinner plates are generally alright as well.  You may be satisfied at Casa Mexicana, but you'll probably be much happier just walking 6 more blocks into the mission, where you have many more choices.
author: c b.

description: Generally mediocre burritos and tacos.  I've rarely, if ever, had anything really good from this place.  When I go it's only because it's the only burrito place convenient to my house.  As someone else put it here, this is a place of last resort, which I will fall back on when I'm too lazy to walk to El Farolito or Papalote.  The meats are nowhere near as good as those on offer at the Mission taquerias and the final product is often simply lacking in flavor.
author: Sasha W.

description: Definitely MEDIOCRE! I'd rather drive to El Metate in the mission for gringo Mexican food than walk down the street to this place. I had the microwaved enchiladas...so so, the red sauce was watered down chili powder without the hot spice. This place was recommended to me by a drunken white guy. I should have known it wasn't a solid recommendation. It was pretty inexpensive so I can't complain there. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have grapefruit flavored Jarritos. Since it is in my neighborhood, I will give it another shot. Perhaps something they don't have to microwave???? The re-fried beans were pretty good though.
author: Leanna S.

description: Azteca taco is bell pepper, onion & beef or chicken grilled up fresh on a couple corn tortillas for under $3.50 incl tax and very tasty. Burritos are OK too. If you need a bite in the neighborhood, I'd recommend them.
author: Paul F.
